set up.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to start a company, organization, committee etc
set up.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Now Betterware plans to set up shop elsewhere in Europe.
set up shop/set up in business
They want to set up their own import–export business.
new regulations for setting up political parties
John decided to set up as a graphic designer.
set up.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to make the arrangements that are necessary for something to happen
set up.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: I’ll set up an appointment for you.
There was a lot of work involved in setting up the festival.
set up.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to prepare the equipment that will be needed for an activity so that it is ready to be used
set up.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The next band was already setting up on the other stage.
Can someone set the overhead projector up?
set up.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to place or build something somewhere, especially something that is not permanent
set up.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: They’ve set up roadblocks around the city.
set up.translation[0].definitions[4].def: to trick someone in order to achieve what you want, especially to make it appear that they have done something wrong or illegal
set up.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: Cox claimed that the police had tried to set him up.
set up.translation[0].definitions[5].def: to provide someone with money that they need, especially in order to start a business
set up.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: After he qualified as a doctor, his mother set him up in a practice of his own.
Selling her share of the company has set her up for life.
set up.translation[0].definitions[6].def: to make you feel healthy and full of energy
set up.translation[0].definitions[6].exa: A good breakfast will set you up for the day.
set up.translation[0].definitions[7].def: to deliberately make people believe that you have the authority and skill to do something, especially when this is not true
set up.translation[0].definitions[7].exa: politicians who set themselves up as moral authorities
set up.translation[0].definitions[8].def: to put someone in a position in which they are able to do something, or in which something is likely to happen to them
set up.translation[0].definitions[8].exa: If he won the fight, it would set him up for a title shot.
Anyone with public duties sets themselves up for attack.
set up.translation[0].definitions[9].def: to arrange for two people to meet, because you think they might start a romantic relationship
set up.translation[0].definitions[9].exa: ‘How did you meet Nick?’ ‘A friend set us up.’
set up.translation[0].definitions[10].de: to get your own home, furniture etc, especially when you leave your parents’ home to live with a wife, husband, or partner
set up.translation[0].definitions[10].ex: Many parents try to help their children set up home.
set up.translation[0].definitions[11].de: to start making a loud unpleasant noise
set up.translation[0].definitions[11].ex: The party guests were setting up a steady din.
set up.translation[1].definitions[0].def: the way that something is organized or arranged
set up.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a dishonest plan that is intended to trick someone
set up.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: How do I know this isn’t a set-up?
set up.translation[1].definitions[2].def: the act of organizing something, such as a business or a computer system
set up.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: The IT department will assist you with installation and setup.
set up.translation[1].definitions[3].def: several pieces of equipment that work together in a system
set up.translation[1].definitions[3].exa: ‘Do you use the school darkroom?’ ‘No, I’ve got my own setup at home.’
set up.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to start a company, organization, committee etc
set up.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The bank is hopeful of setting up a branch office in Shanghai soon.
Better promotion of the the area is intended to make it more attractive to firms setting up.
set up.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: There are many tax advantages that encourage foreign banks to set up shop here.
He would prefer to set up in business as an independent financial adviser.
set up.translation[2].definitions[2].def: to make all the arrangements so that something can happen, such as a meeting, event, or a system for doing something
set up.translation[2].definitions[2].exa: Several companies set up 24-hour telephone hotlines to deal with enquiries.
He recently set up a stress-management class that was attended by about 60 workers.
set up.translation[3].definitions[0].def: the way something is organized or arranged
set up.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: The trust will be managed by a board of directors, although that setup requires regulatory approval.
set up.translation[3].definitions[1].def: all the parts that work together in a system, especially a computer system
set up.translation[3].definitions[1].exa: Multimedia setups can mix video clips, recorded speech, music, and computer graphics.
